And while more than 20 million people still collected unemployment in late January, economists are hopeful that the recent downward trend in Covid cases will allow the labor market to mend further.</span>

This deficit, which does not include Biden's proposed $1.9 trillion stimulus plan, would come in below fiscal 2020's deficit of $3.1 trillion.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
IPO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/11/bumble-goes-public-8b-valuation?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Who's Ready to Bumble?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="A gif of Bumble Founder and CEO Whitney Wolfe Herd ringing the bell at Bumble HQ for her company's IPO; in one arm, she is holding her infant son" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=377 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/nr0JuYGPlRTjpfpS6g/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="A gif of Bumble Founder and CEO Whitney Wolfe Herd ringing the bell at Bumble HQ for her company's IPO; in one arm, she is holding her infant son" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/nr0JuYGPlRTjpfpS6g/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Bumble</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That kid has no idea what he just witnessed. Yesterday, America's No. 2 dating app <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/02/11/bumble-ipo-bmbl-starts-trading-on-nasdaq.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">went public</a>, gaining 63% on the day to close at a $8+ billion valuation.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In case you've had a ring on it since 2014, Bumble is a dating app famous for letting women swipe first and initiate conversation. Founder and CEO Whitney Wolfe Herd created it to combat rampant sexual harassment on dating platforms. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Wolfe Herd previously cofounded Tinder, but left after suing the company for...sexual harassment and discrimination. </span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">How it makes that honey </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Bumble used to be part of MagicLab, a company that operated various social and dating apps. In 2019, private equity giant Blackstone took a majority stake in MagicLab and put Wolfe Herd in charge, then rebranded the larger company as Bumble last year. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The app offers a free tier to its 12+ million monthly active users, but earns most of its revenue from premium subscriptions and in-app purchases. In the first nine months of 2020, it posted a net loss of $84 million on nearly $377 million in sales. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In addition to expanding internationally, Bumble has grown its business with: </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>BFF, a matchmaking app for friends</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Bizz, a professional networking platform</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Bumble Fund, which offers early-stage investments for women entrepreneurs of color </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But Bumble has plenty of catching up to do to $46 billion rival Match Group, which owns Tinder, Hinge, and OkCupid.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">This IPO broke lots of glass</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Of the roughly 560 IPOs from the last 12 months, Bumble <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-02-11/bumble-s-31-year-old-ceo-becomes-a-rare-female-billionaire?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">is the third</a> with a female founder; only eight IPOs from last year had a female CEO. Over 70% of Bumble's board is women, a rarity in corporate America. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">At 31, Wolfe Herd is the youngest woman to take a company public and her $900+ million stake pushes her fortune above $1 billion. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Of the 500 wealthiest people in the world, self-made women account for <5%, per Bloomberg. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Because so few female founders or CEOs make it to the IPO stage, the tremendous wealth generated through startup exits disproportionately goes to male investors and beneficiaries. </p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CRYPTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/11/cant-ignore-price-anymore-traditional-businesses-venture-crypto?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Mainstream Biz Embraces Crypto
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="bitcoin bull" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zNzU1L2JpdGNvaW5fYnVsbC5wbmciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">After Tesla's <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/08/tesla-buys-15-billion-worth-bitcoin?email=eliza.carter34@gmail.com&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">cannonball</a> into bitcoin on Monday, more established parts of the biz world are wading into the crypto waters. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, the US' oldest bank, BNY Mellon, said it will hold, transfer, and <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/bitcoin-to-come-to-america-s-oldest-bank-bny-mellon-11613044810?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">issue cryptos</a> for its asset management clients. Wall Street used to be cagey about crypto because of its volatility and legal-ish status, but bankers are getting lots of "sooo…btc <img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/rocket_1f680.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt=""> <img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/new-moon-with-face_1f31a.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt="">?" texts from institutional clients now as bitcoin and other digital token prices soar (bitcoin hit another high Thursday). </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Mastercard also said yesterday it will support some cryptos, including bitcoin, on its network later this year, following Square and PayPal. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Not to be outmaneuvered by the finance sector, Twitter, GM, and Uber also all signaled openness to receiving cryptocurrencies. All three <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/02/11/uber-wont-buy-bitcoin-with-its-cash-may-later-accept-it-as-payment.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a> in earnings calls this week that, while they wouldn't follow Elon down the investment path, they were open to accepting cryptos as payment from vendors and customers. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Momentum was building even before Tesla's move. Michael Sonnenshein, CEO of digital asset manager Grayscale Investments, <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2021/02/09/investing/premarket-stocks-trading/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a> interest in crypto helped push assets under management to over $20 billion from just $2 billion over the course of last year. </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MUSIC
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/11/taylor-swift-drops-rerecording-early-song?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Look What You Made Her Re-Do
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Taylor Swift onstage at the ACMAs with a guitar " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80MDM0L3RheWxvcl9zd2lmdC5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>ACMA2020/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday on <em>Good Morning America</em>, Taylor Swift <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/music/2021/feb/11/taylor-swift-releases-new-versions-of--first-six-albums?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announced</a> that she has finished re-recording her second and most successful album, <em>Fearless</em>. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>A re-recording of the song "Love Story," originally released in 2008, dropped at midnight ET last night. The new version of </span><span><em>Fearless</em></span><span>, titled </span><span><em>Fearless (Taylor's Version)</em></span><span>, will be released on April 9. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory </strong>is now music biz legend on par with the Tupac hologram. Swift started her career with label Big Machine, which recorded and retained the rights to her first six albums (2006's <em>Taylor Swift</em>–2017's <em>Reputation</em>). But in 2018, Swift struck a deal with Universal that gave her ownership of her music. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The next year, Big Machine sold the master recordings to music manager Scooter Braun, whom Swift has accused of bullying. </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Then in November, Braun </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/02/11/taylor-swift-rerecorded-fearless-releasing-love-story-at-midnight.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sold the masters</a></span><span> to investment firm Shamrock Holdings for a reported $300 million. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Swift has maintained that throughout the selling and re-selling, she was stonewalled from any opportunity to buy her music back. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The nowstory:</strong> Taylor's revenge. Re-recording her early albums means the value of the masters will shrink. </p>

</p>

<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Part II of our cannabis investing series is here. And this time, we’re talking <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/03/government-high-marijuana-time-will-tell" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><strong style="color:#000">legalization</strong></a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Since it’s the biggest obstacle to <strong style="color:#000">adding pot to your portfolio</strong>, we unpacked <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/03/government-high-marijuana-time-will-tell" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">what’s ahead in legislative reform</a> for the cannabis industry. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Decriminalization, the Democratic Party, and CBD all may make or break your investing plans. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So, make your parents proud and study up on <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/03/government-high-marijuana-time-will-tell" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">what’s next for the marijuana industry</a> and its potential for your portfolio. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/03/government-high-marijuana-time-will-tell" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Read Part II of our series on marijuana investing</a>.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/11/microsoft-calls-us-make-big-tech-pay-news?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Microsoft Says Google and FB Should Pay
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Personalized news" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=447 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/fqdXwROanKYFMhnHhs/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Personalized news" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/fqdXwROanKYFMhnHhs/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, Microsoft President Brad Smith said the US <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/microsoft-urges-u-s-to-make-tech-giants-pay-for-news-11613066402?mod=hp_lista_pos2&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">should follow</a> Australia's recent efforts and make tech platforms pay for news content they carry. Easy stance to take when your search engine is Bing.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Australia's proposed law would require tech companies to negotiate fees with publishers, head to arbitration if they can't, and be more transparent about how their algorithms surface content.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Google and Facebook hate it</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Google threatened to shut down its search engine in Australia, and Facebook said it would block users from sharing links. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Their argument: </strong>Australia's law sets a dangerous precedent for the free flow of information and could put platforms <a href="https://www.dw.com/en/google-vs-australia-5-questions-and-answers/a-56340697?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">on the hook</a> for billions. Plus, both companies are already paying some publishers for content (Google has promised $1 billion over three years).</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">The counterargument:</strong></span><span> Google and Facebook earn $$$ running ads next to articles like "10 Secrets to Get Hemsworth Abs," but publishers don't see any of it. And as two of the world's biggest platforms, they don't have much incentive to negotiate. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>the parliamentary committee reviewing Australia's proposal is expected to release their anticipated report today.</p>

<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Ok, pay attention because this week's Friday Puzzle is our most epic yet and will last over the course of the week. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The game: </strong>Take an eight-by-eight grid and fill it in with names of companies. Your goal is to create a grid with the <em>highest total market value</em>. We made an example below...but you can do better. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80MDM1L2dyaWQucG5nIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIn0=" class="img-responsive" width="640" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;" alt="" data-reactroot=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Let's add up the total: Facebook ($770B) + Apple ($2.26T) + Amazon ($1.64T) + Exxon ($211B) = $4.88 trillion </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We'll show the winning grid in next week's newsletter and give the creator a shoutout. How can you enter? Complete your grid, post it to social media, and tag us on either <a href="https://twitter.com/morningbrew?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Twitter</a> or <a href="https://www.instagram.com/morningbrew/?hl=en&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Instagram</a>. Entries close Thursday at noon. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">A few final notes: </strong>To find a company's market value, just Google it or search for "most valuable companies in the S&P." Each company must intersect with at least one other company in the grid. And no stock tickers allowed (abbreviations like GM or GE <em>are </em>allowed, within reason). </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Good luck!</p>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

And while more than 20 million people still collected unemployment in late January, economists are hopeful that the recent downward trend in Covid cases will allow the labor market to mend further.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBudget: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe federal budget deficit will \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/02/11/deficit-projected-at-2point3-trillion-for-2021-not-counting-additional-stimulus-cbo-says.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehit $2.3 trillion\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e during the 2021 fiscal year, per the nonpartisan Congressional Budget Office. This deficit, which does not include Biden's proposed $1.9 trillion stimulus plan, would come in below fiscal 2020's deficit of $3.1 trillion.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eGovernment: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eHouse Democrats \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cbsnews.com/live-updates/trump-impeachment-trial-day-3-2021-02-11/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003econcluded their arguments\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e for convicting former President Trump of inciting the Jan. 6 attack on the Capitol. The defense is up today. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003c!-- END MARKETS --\u003e\n\u003c!-- ARTICLE ---\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"c6 \" style=\"margin-bottom:7px\"\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003cth class=\"card\" style=\"text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px\"\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding: 15px;\"\u003e\n\u003ch3 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nIPO\n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/11/bumble-goes-public-8b-valuation?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nWho's Ready to Bumble?\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if mso]\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"A gif of Bumble Founder and CEO Whitney Wolfe Herd ringing the bell at Bumble HQ for her company's IPO; in one arm, she is holding her infant son\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" height=377 src=\"https://media.giphy.com/media/nr0JuYGPlRTjpfpS6g/giphy.gif\"\u003e\n\u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso]\u003e--\u003e\u003c!-- --\u003e\n\u003cimg class=\"story-header-image\" alt=\"A gif of Bumble Founder and CEO Whitney Wolfe Herd ringing the bell at Bumble HQ for her company's IPO; in one arm, she is holding her infant son\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" src=\"https://media.giphy.com/media/nr0JuYGPlRTjpfpS6g/giphy.gif\"\u003e\n\u003c!--\u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eBumble\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThat kid has no idea what he just witnessed. Yesterday, America's No. 2 dating app \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/02/11/bumble-ipo-bmbl-starts-trading-on-nasdaq.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewent public\u003c/a\u003e, gaining 63% on the day to close at a $8+ billion valuation.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn case you've had a ring on it since 2014, Bumble is a dating app famous for letting women swipe first and initiate conversation. Founder and CEO Whitney Wolfe Herd created it to combat rampant sexual harassment on dating platforms. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWolfe Herd previously cofounded Tinder, but left after suing the company for...sexual harassment and discrimination. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eHow it makes that honey \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBumble used to be part of MagicLab, a company that operated various social and dating apps. In 2019, private equity giant Blackstone took a majority stake in MagicLab and put Wolfe Herd in charge, then rebranded the larger company as Bumble last year. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe app offers a free tier to its 12+ million monthly active users, but earns most of its revenue from premium subscriptions and in-app purchases. In the first nine months of 2020, it posted a net loss of $84 million on nearly $377 million in sales. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn addition to expanding internationally, Bumble has grown its business with: \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBFF, a matchmaking app for friends\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBizz, a professional networking platform\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBumble Fund, which offers early-stage investments for women entrepreneurs of color \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut Bumble has plenty of catching up to do to $46 billion rival Match Group, which owns Tinder, Hinge, and OkCupid.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThis IPO broke lots of glass\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOf the roughly 560 IPOs from the last 12 months, Bumble \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-02-11/bumble-s-31-year-old-ceo-becomes-a-rare-female-billionaire?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eis the third\u003c/a\u003e with a female founder; only eight IPOs from last year had a female CEO. Over 70% of Bumble's board is women, a rarity in corporate America. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAt 31, Wolfe Herd is the youngest woman to take a company public and her $900+ million stake pushes her fortune above $1 billion. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eOf the 500 wealthiest people in the world, self-made women account for \u003c5%, per Bloomberg. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eBecause so few female founders or CEOs make it to the IPO stage, the tremendous wealth generated through startup exits disproportionately goes to male investors and beneficiaries. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAfter Tesla's \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/08/tesla-buys-15-billion-worth-bitcoin?email=eliza.carter34@gmail.com\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecannonball\u003c/a\u003e into bitcoin on Monday, more established parts of the biz world are wading into the crypto waters. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, the US' oldest bank, BNY Mellon, said it will hold, transfer, and \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/bitcoin-to-come-to-america-s-oldest-bank-bny-mellon-11613044810?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eissue cryptos\u003c/a\u003e for its asset management clients. Wall Street used to be cagey about crypto because of its volatility and legal-ish status, but bankers are getting lots of \"sooo…btc \u003cimg src=\"https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/rocket_1f680.png\" width=\"18\" style=\"max-width:18px\" alt=\"\"\u003e \u003cimg src=\"https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/new-moon-with-face_1f31a.png\" width=\"18\" style=\"max-width:18px\" alt=\"\"\u003e?\" texts from institutional clients now as bitcoin and other digital token prices soar (bitcoin hit another high Thursday). \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eMastercard also said yesterday it will support some cryptos, including bitcoin, on its network later this year, following Square and PayPal. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNot to be outmaneuvered by the finance sector, Twitter, GM, and Uber also all signaled openness to receiving cryptocurrencies. All three \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/02/11/uber-wont-buy-bitcoin-with-its-cash-may-later-accept-it-as-payment.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e in earnings calls this week that, while they wouldn't follow Elon down the investment path, they were open to accepting cryptos as payment from vendors and customers. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eMomentum was building even before Tesla's move. Michael Sonnenshein, CEO of digital asset manager Grayscale Investments, \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2021/02/09/investing/premarket-stocks-trading/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e interest in crypto helped push assets under management to over $20 billion from just $2 billion over the course of last year. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday on \u003cem\u003eGood Morning America\u003c/em\u003e, Taylor Swift \u003ca href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/music/2021/feb/11/taylor-swift-releases-new-versions-of--first-six-albums?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eannounced\u003c/a\u003e that she has finished re-recording her second and most successful album, \u003cem\u003eFearless\u003c/em\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eA re-recording of the song \"Love Story,\" originally released in 2008, dropped at midnight ET last night. The new version of \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eFearless\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, titled \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eFearless (Taylor's Version)\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, will be released on April 9. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory \u003c/strong\u003eis now music biz legend on par with the Tupac hologram. Swift started her career with label Big Machine, which recorded and retained the rights to her first six albums (2006's \u003cem\u003eTaylor Swift\u003c/em\u003e–2017's \u003cem\u003eReputation\u003c/em\u003e). But in 2018, Swift struck a deal with Universal that gave her ownership of her music. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe next year, Big Machine sold the master recordings to music manager Scooter Braun, whom Swift has accused of bullying. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThen in November, Braun \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/02/11/taylor-swift-rerecorded-fearless-releasing-love-story-at-midnight.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esold the masters\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e to investment firm Shamrock Holdings for a reported $300 million. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSwift has maintained that throughout the selling and re-selling, she was stonewalled from any opportunity to buy her music back. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe nowstory:\u003c/strong\u003e Taylor's revenge. Re-recording her early albums means the value of the masters will shrink. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, Microsoft President Brad Smith said the US \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/microsoft-urges-u-s-to-make-tech-giants-pay-for-news-11613066402?mod=hp_lista_pos2\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eshould follow\u003c/a\u003e Australia's recent efforts and make tech platforms pay for news content they carry. Easy stance to take when your search engine is Bing.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAustralia's proposed law would require tech companies to negotiate fees with publishers, head to arbitration if they can't, and be more transparent about how their algorithms surface content.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eGoogle and Facebook hate it\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eGoogle threatened to shut down its search engine in Australia, and Facebook said it would block users from sharing links. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eTheir argument: \u003c/strong\u003eAustralia's law sets a dangerous precedent for the free flow of information and could put platforms \u003ca href=\"https://www.dw.com/en/google-vs-australia-5-questions-and-answers/a-56340697?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eon the hook\u003c/a\u003e for billions. Plus, both companies are already paying some publishers for content (Google has promised $1 billion over three years).\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe counterargument:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e Google and Facebook earn $$$ running ads next to articles like \"10 Secrets to Get Hemsworth Abs,\" but publishers don't see any of it. And as two of the world's biggest platforms, they don't have much incentive to negotiate. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ethe parliamentary committee reviewing Australia's proposal is
